suggestedNewContent.title: Text Styling is Like Formatting in Word
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Expand the word processor analogy with a visual comparison: TextStyle is like the font formatting toolbar (font, size, color, bold, italic, underline), textAlign is like paragraph alignment, and Text.rich is like selecting different parts of a sentence and applying different formatting to each

suggestedNewContent.title: Styling Different Parts of Text with Text.rich
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Introduce Text.rich constructor and TextSpan for creating mixed-style text. Show how to display 'Hello beautiful world' with different colors/weights for each word. This is a crucial real-world pattern.

suggestedNewContent.title: Making Text Selectable and Copyable
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Introduce SelectableText widget as an alternative to Text when users need to copy content. Mention SelectionArea for making multiple widgets selectable.

suggestedNewContent.title: Using Theme-Based Text Styles
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show how to use Theme.of(context).textTheme.headlineMedium etc. for consistent styling across the app. Explain that this is the recommended approach over hardcoding TextStyle values.

suggestedNewContent.title: Common Text Widget Mistakes
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover: 1) Text overflow in Row (need Expanded), 2) TextOverflow.fade requires softWrap: false, 3) Unexpected styles from DefaultTextStyle inheritance, 4) softWrap vs maxLines difference, 5) Using const for performance

suggestedNewContent.title: Building a Product Price Display
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Practical example showing currency symbol in smaller gray text and price amount in larger bold colored text using Text.rich and TextSpan. Demonstrates real-world mixed-style text usage.

suggestedNewContent.title: Text Overflow Options Explained
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain all TextOverflow options (ellipsis, fade, clip, visible) with visual examples showing when to use each. Include interaction with softWrap and maxLines.
